foreignObject.div: 7. Maintenance: id, bus_id, details, date, cost
6. Expenses: id, bus_id, type, amount, date, description
5. Drivers: id, name, contact, license_number, bus_id
4. Trips: id, bus_id, route_id, driver_id, date, passenger_count, revenue
3. Routes: id, name, start_point, end_point, stops, distance
2. Buses: id, number, model, capacity, registration_details, insurance_expiry
1. Users: id, username, password, role
/api/users (login, CRUD)
/api/trips (GET, POST, PUT, DELETE)
/api/routes (GET, POST, PUT, DELETE)
/api/buses (GET, POST, PUT, DELETE)
6. Settings: General settings and user preferences.
5. Reports: Graphs and data tables.
4. Trip Records: Daily trip entry form and table.
3. Route Management: Manage routes and schedules.
2. Bus Management: CRUD (Create, Read, Update, Delete) for buses.
1. Dashboard: Overview of key metrics (revenue, trips, buses active, etc.).
Analyze trip statistics: average passengers, peak hours, etc.
List buses due for maintenance.
View expenses by category or bus.
View revenue by bus, route, or date.
Manage payments for drivers and other staff.
Track driver and staff attendance.
Fields: Name, Contact, License Number, Bus Assigned, Routes Covered.
Add/edit/remove driver profiles.
Generate daily, weekly, or monthly reports.
Record expenses (fuel, maintenance, driver wages, etc.).
Fields: Bus Number, Route, Date, Revenue.
Calculate total revenue collected from all buses.
Track ticket details and revenue for each trip.
Fields: Bus Number, Route, Driver, Date, Passenger Count, Revenue, etc.
Record daily trips for each bus.
Fields: Bus Number, Driver, Departure Time, Arrival Time, Frequency.
Define schedules for each route.
Fields: Route Name, Start Point, End Point, Stops, Distance, etc.
Add/edit/remove routes.
Add details like fuel quantity, cost, and supplier.
Record daily/weekly fuel expenses for each bus.
Schedule reminders for periodic maintenance.
Track bus maintenance history.
Fields: Bus Number, Model, Capacity, Registration Details, Insurance Expiry, etc.
Add/edit/remove bus information.
Role-based access (e.g., data entry, route management).
Add staff members who can access specific parts of the system.
Manage passwords and access rights.
Add, edit, or remove admins.
Database: Use managed services like AWS RDS or Azure SQL.
Backend: Deploy via Docker or directly to a cloud server.
Frontend: Deploy via platforms like Netlify or Vercel.
Use a cloud platform like AWS, Azure, or Heroku.
Perform user testing for usability.
Ensure proper error handling on both frontend and backend.
Test API endpoints with tools like Postman.
Implement responsive design for mobile and desktop.
Fetch data from backend APIs and display it dynamically.
Build reusable components (e.g., tables, forms, graphs).
Implement authentication (e.g., JWT tokens).
Build REST APIs for all the main modules (e.g., Bus Management, Route Management).
Create the database schema.
Tables:
Database: PostgreSQL, MySQL, or MongoDB.
API Endpoints:
Framework: Node.js with Express or Python's Django/Flask.
Pages and Components:
Framework: React.js, Angular, or Vue.js for a modern and responsive UI.
Configure app settings, notifications, reminders, etc.
Hosting: AWS, Heroku, or similar.
Version Control: Git and GitHub/GitLab.
Database: PostgreSQL or MySQL.
Backend: Node.js (Express), or Django/Flask.
Frontend: React.js, Bootstrap/Tailwind CSS.
